newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH CLOSING SHARE MARKET REPORT.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH CLOSING SHARE MARKET REPORT.

text.p: Dutch shares closed with modest gains, braking a fall which lopped almost 40 points off the AEX index in the two sessions after Thursday's record close of 1011.
The AEX, made up of 25 blue chip shares, gained 5.33 points at 978.40, but this closing level was well below an intraday high of 985.45 reached on an early wave of retail buy orders.

Paper-maker KNP BT, tipped by many analysts to outperform after lagging other cyclicals so far this year, gained 2.00 guilders or 4.1 percent at 50.30. Publisher Elsevier rose 1.10 guilders or 3.3 pct to 33.90 in a partial recovery from steep losses after last week's results.
Dealers said the market's mood was cautious and many predicted a flat performance for shares in the rest of August after a big run up so far this year and a strong surge in July.
